1.text: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and grease a baking sheet.

2.text: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into florets.

3.text: Toss the florets with lemon juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.

4.text: Spread the cauliflower on the sheet and bake it for 20 to 25 minutes.

5.text: Sprinkle 1/2 cup (50 g) of parmesan over the florets.

6.text: Cook the florets for 3 to 5 minutes.

7.text: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into bite-sized pieces.

8.text: Bring a pot of water to boil over high heat.

9.text: Add the cauliflower to the pot and boil it for 5 to 7 minutes.

10.text: Drain the cauliflower in a colander.

11.text: Season the florets with salt and pepper.

12.text: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets.

13.text: Pour 2 to 3 tablespoons (30 to 44 ml) of water into the bowl and cover it loosely.

14.text: Microwave the cauliflower for 3 to 4 minutes.

15.text: Leave the cauliflower in the microwave for 1 minute before you take it out.

18.text: Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-low.

19.text: Cut each cauliflower into 2 or 3 thick steaks.

20.text: Brush both sides of the steaks with 1⁄4 cup (59 ml) of olive oil.

21.text: Mix the salt, pepper, garlic, powder, and paprika and season the steaks.

22.text: Place the steaks over direct heat and grill them for 14 to 16 minutes.

23.text: Move the steaks to indirect heat.

24.text: Grill the cauliflower for another 15 to 20 minutes.
